x10.matrix.block

Class SparseBlock

  • x10.lang.Object
    • x10.matrix.block.MatrixBlock
      • x10.matrix.block.SparseBlock

  • public class SparseBlock
extends MatrixBlock
    Sparse block is used to build sparse block matrix (at single place) or distributed sparse matrix at all places.

      • make

        public static SparseBlock make(Grid gp,
               x10.lang.Int rid,
               x10.lang.Int cid,
               Compress2D cdat)
        Create a sparse-matrix block based on matrix partitioning.
        Parameters:
        gp - The grid partitioning of matrix
        rid - block's row id
        cid - block's column id
        cdat - the sparse matrix's compress2D data structure

      • make

        public static SparseBlock make(Grid gp,
               x10.lang.Int rid,
               x10.lang.Int cid,
               x10.lang.Int nzcnt)
        Create a sparse-matrix block and allocate memory space for specified number of nonzero elements.
        Parameters:
        gp - The grid partitioning of matrix
        rid - block's row id
        cid - block's column id
        nzcnt - number of nonzero element in block

      • make

        public static SparseBlock make(Grid gp,
               x10.lang.Int rid,
               x10.lang.Int cid,
               x10.lang.Double nzd)
        Create a sparse-matrix block and allocate memory space for specified nonzer sparsity
        Parameters:
        gp - The grid partitioning of matrix
        rid - block's row id
        cid - block's column id
        nzd - sparsity in block

      • init

        public void init(x10.lang.Double ival)
        Initialize the sparse-matrix block with a constant value. The sparsity used in initialization is the specified by the field of " "nonZeroDensity" in SparseCSC.
        Parameters:
        ival - the initial used constant value

      • initRandom

        Initialize the sparse matrix block with random values.

        Parameters:
        nzd - sparsity of the block

        Copy columns from source sparse block to a matrix of same type.
        

        Parameters:
        srcoff - the starting columns from the source block matrix to copy
        colcnt - number of columns to copy
        dstmat - target matrix, must be SparseCSC type
